name: biomni-create-harmony-embeddings
title: Biomni: Create Harmony Embeddings
description: Generate Harmony batch-corrected embeddings for single-cell RNA-seq data
content:
Overview

Generates Harmony batch-corrected low-dimensional embeddings for single-cell RNA-seq data. This tool removes batch effects and technical variation while preserving biological signals, enabling integration of datasets from multiple experiments, platforms, or laboratories for unified downstream analysis.

Input Parameters

  • adata_file (string): Path to AnnData H5AD file containing single-cell expression data from stash
  • batch_key (string, required): Column name in adata.obs containing batch information (e.g., sample ID, donor, experiment)
  • output (string): Output directory path

Input Format

Provide a JSON file with the following structure:

{
  "adata_file": "/path/to/scrna_data.h5ad",
  "batch_key": "batch_id",
  "output": "/output/directory"
}

Biological Use Case

Essential for integrating single-cell datasets with batch effects from different experiments, sequencing runs, or donors. Used to create unified cell atlases, perform meta-analyses across studies, enable cross-platform comparisons, and identify consistent biological signals obscured by technical variation.

Output

Generates harmony_log.txt with batch correction statistics and harmony_emb_data.h5ad containing the Harmony-corrected embeddings stored in adata.obsm for downstream clustering and visualization.

Category

genomics
